A GOVERNMENT agency is launching an inquiry into doctors' reports that up to 50 babies a year are born alive after botched National Health Service abortions. The investigation, by the Confidential Enquiry into Maternal and Child Health (CEMACH), comes amid growing unease among clinicians over a legal ambiguity that could see them being charged with infanticide. 
 
 The Royal College of Obstetricians and Gynaecologists, which regulates methods of abortion, has also mounted its own investigation"
 
 http://www.timesonline.co.uk/article/0,,2087-1892696,00.html

post_info.post_title: Sunday Times: Fifty babies a year are alive after abortion

We should ask those 50 people what their stance on abortion is.

 Indeed. More you think about the article the more you have to question the nature of what it reports. Obivously its true but the reality is unlikely to be as shocking as the headline suggests.
 
 On a slightly different tack the article is interesting as an example of how to subtley transfer a meaning (abortion is bad) without actually having to state the opinion in anyway.

 Wow, how do you botch an abortion and have the baby born alive? I can see how they could accidentally harm the mother, but have the baby born alive? These are supposed to be professionals.
